title: How to Make a Song on GarageBand

steps.title: Make sure you have the necessary equipment.
steps.content: Make sure you have the necessary equipment. If you want to create and record a song, the best way to do so is by using a MIDI keyboard and USB microphone, as using your Mac's built-in microphone will severely diminish the quality of your recording. You can also use your computer's keyboard keys and built-in microphone to create your song, but the quality may suffer (especially the audio).

steps.title: Plug in your equipment.
steps.content: Plug in your equipment. If you're using a piano keyboard (or something similar) to record in GarageBand, you'll need to plug it into your Mac. If your Mac uses Thunderbolt 3 (USB-C) ports instead of USB 3.0 ports, you may also need a USB 3.0 to USB-C adapter. Skip this step if you don't have a MIDI piano or similar controller. If you're using a USB microphone for the vocals, you'll want to plug it in as well.

steps.title: Open GarageBand.
steps.content: Open GarageBand. Click Spotlight , type in garageband , and double-click GarageBand at the top of the results. This will open the GarageBand window.

steps.title: Create a new project.
steps.content: Create a new project. Regardless of what opens in GarageBand, you can create a new project by doing the following: Click File Click New... Click Empty Project , then click Choose Select Software Project Click Create

steps.title: Create your song's instrumental.
steps.content: Create your song's instrumental. Add a new track by clicking Track , clicking New Track , selecting Software Instrument , and clicking Create , then do the following: Select an instrument from the "Library" section on the left of the window. Bring up Musical Typing if necessary by clicking Window and then clicking Show Musical Typing Click the red "Record" circle at the top of the window. Play your song's notes, then click the "Record" circle again. Repeat by adding a new track and playing music until your song's instrumental is finished.

steps.title: Consider using a loop.
steps.content: Consider using a loop. Loops are pre-made sections of music that you can add to your project. To add a loop, do the following: Click the loop-shaped icon in the upper-right corner of the window. Preview a loop by clicking it. Add the loop to GarageBand by dragging it into the main window. Extend the loop (if necessary) by clicking and dragging its upper-right corner.

steps.title: Record your vocals.
steps.content: Record your vocals. Create a microphone track by clicking Track , clicking New Track , selecting the microphone audio option, making sure your USB microphone is selected (if necessary), and clicking Create . Once your audio track is added to the project, you can record your vocals over the instrumental by clicking the "Record" button and singing to your heart's content. Be sure to click the "Record" button again when you're done recording. You may want to record multiple versions of your vocals in order to layer the vocals on top of one another.

steps.title: Listen to your whole song.
steps.content: Listen to your whole song. Once you're done recording as needed, drag the playhead all the way to the far-left side of the window, then click the "Play" button. If you're satisfied with your project, you can proceed with exporting it to an MP3 file. If you need to make any edits to your project, do so before continuing.

steps.title: Export your project.
steps.content: Export your project. This will create an MP3 file which you can play on any computer: Click Share Click Export to Disk... Enter your song's information. Click Export
